byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Lansing, and Monica Davey and Mitch Smith from Chicago. Nicholas Fandos contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN, MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Some 247 pages of emails made public by Michigan Gov Rick Snyder reveal state officials reacted with irritation to mounting complaints about water crisis in city of Flint and in some cases questioned validity of complaints; emails show state officials were eager to place blame for crisis on local officials and were reluctant to acknowledge extent of problem even in face of evidence.
lead_paragraph: Residents’ complaints about their water’s foul odor and odd color were met with irritation from Michigan officials, according to emails released by the governor.

headline.main: As Water Problems Grew, Officials Belittled Complaints From Flint
headline.print_headline: As Water Problems Grew, Officials Belittled Complaints From Flint
